chargeHist.descr: Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin R. Dunay was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Sexual Exploitation-Employ,Use,Induce, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.05(1)(a).
  • Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).
  • Cause Child 13-18 to View Sex. Activity, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to all counts.

**06-21-2019 Court finds Defendant in Contempt twice. Orders the Defendant to serve 60 days consecutive to any other sentence.**

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution is contested.  A hearing is to be scheduled.

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.  The Defendant is to have no direct or in-direct contact with K.M.C. or her family, school, or employment.  Defendant is to have no contact with anyone under age 18 without prior approval of agent.  The Defendant is to comply with sex offender registry.  Defendant shall not use or possess a computer or cellphone or any device to access the internet or social media sites.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.
**06-21-2019 Court finds Defendant in Contempt twice. Orders the Defendant to pay $1,000.00 fine.**

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that on or before August 31, 2022, Kevin Dunay may file either a new verified petition for a writ of habeas corpus or a second supplement to his original petition, as discussed above. If Dunay fails to file either a new or second supplemental petition within the time set by this order, we will review the existing petition and first supplement to that petition. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that review of the existing petition and supplement is on hold pending further order of this court; filed by Court of Appeals
